conclusion: Determine the critical angle for total internal reflection and corresponding area on the curved surface.
Calculate critical angle using sin θc = 1/n, resulting in θc = 30°.
At critical angle, light refracts at 90° to the normal, making angle with horizontal plane 60°.
Central angle α subtended by arc is 120°.
Total area of semi-cylindrical surface is πR² + 2πR × L/2.
Area S of curved surface is (α/360°) × 2πR × L.
